description: lwp-request - Simple command line user agent

global_flags.description: credentials for documents that are protected by Basic Authentication.  If the document is protected and you did not specify the username and password with this option, then you will be prompted to provide these values.
Print response status chain with full response headers.
send this HTTP header (you can specify several)
Don't load proxy settings from environment.
Print response status chain. This shows redirect and authorization requests that are handled by the library.
Print request headers in addition to request method and absolute URL.
Set text(ascii) mode for content input and output.  If this option is not used, content input and output is done in binary mode.
Use the specified URL as base

This option is only allowed for requests that take a content, i.e. POST, PUT and PATCH.  You  can force   methods   to   take   content   by   using  the  "-f"  option  together  with  "-c".   The  default  Content-Type  for  POST  is "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".  The default Content-type for the others is "text/plain".
Do not print the content of the response.
Print response headers.  This option is always on for HEAD requests.
Force request through, even if the program believes that the method is illegal.  The server might reject the request eventually.
Print usage message and quit.
Set the If-Modified-Since header on the request
If this option is not used, then the method is derived from the name of the program.
If the content type of the response is not  HTML,  then  this  option  has  no effect.  The legal format values are; "text", "ps", "links", "html" and "dump".
The program also loads proxy settings from the environment.  You can disable this  with  the "-P" option.
Print response status code.  This option is always on for HEAD requests.

the  timeout  value  for the requests.  The timeout is the amount of time that the program will wait for a response from the remote server before it fails.  The default unit for the timeout value is seconds.  You might append "m" or "h" to the timeout value to make it minutes or hours, respectively.  The default timeout is '3m', i.e. 3 minutes.
Print request method and absolute URL as requests are made.
Print the version number of the program and quit.
